p: The role of anti-HBs screening before immunosuppressive therapy remains unclear, and the presence of anti-HBs does not imply prevention of HBV reactivation. However, anti-HBs testing may be helpful for detecting past infection in patients who are HBsAg-negative and anti-HBc-positive. Furthermore, loss of anti-HBs can predict HBV reactivation during surveillance [ 48- 50].
